It is evident that he has gone to great pains to make his visitor comfortable. A mirror has been tacked up on a tree, and under it is a wash basin. Fowler's rifle and shotgun are in a rack near the fireplace. Helen's trunk stands open near the lean-to. Helen, wearing a robe, takes some clothing from it, closes the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fowler turns and smiles. Helen pushes through the curtains into the lean-to. Fowler puts the last of the dishes on the shelf, crosses to the trunk and moves it over to the side of the lean-to. Turning to go back to the fireplace, he stops.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You can put this out of the way, Jed. It's empty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fowler in the f.g. Lednov, rifle in hand, stands just inside the camp on the meadow side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov moves slowly forward to stand near the table. He looks around him. Fowler starts slowly toward the fireplace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to be casual, Fowler moves closer to where the guns are racked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has edged closer to the gun rack. Lednov seems unaware that he is near the guns. His interest is centered on the lean-to. He moves to the entrance, stands with his hand on the canvas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov pulls back the flap. His back is to Fowler, who starts quickly for the tree, only to stop as McCall comes out from behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fowler drops his hands to his side. Lednov turns, grins at Fowler, and enters the lean-to.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (turning slowly) What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw your fire and dropped by to say hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, say it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter -- restless?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, people make me restless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Even women?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There aren't any women here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose that's your wagon in the river.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some people who went by this way lost it. (nervously) Two men and some women. They packed their stuff on horses and went on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you're all alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Suppose I take a look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looking for something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The shelter is dark. Lednov strikes a match and looks around. The place is empty. There is a bunk, made up. On the left hand wall a curtain of gunny sacks covers the clothes hanging there. The match burns down to Lednov's fingers. There is a SOUND of a scuffle outside a blow, and a groan. Lednov drops the match and hurries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov comes out of the lean-to. Fowler is sprawled by the table. McCall stands over him, rifle raised.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hold it, Mac.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT. Helen stands flattened against a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cautiously Helen starts moving away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Fowler pulls himself to his feet. Mac stands near him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fowler sinks on a bench, his head in his hands. Lednov moves closer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Where'd the women go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When I ask questions, I like to hear answers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They went on like I told you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Helen cautiously moves away from the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A twig snaps underfoot. Helen freezes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long ago?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five, six hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Lednov is staring off in the direction of Helen. McCall moves to the edge of the lean-to, looking off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT. Helen starts forward again, more cautiously than ever. She reaches a tree, turns to look back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen, back to camera, is in immediate f.g. Through the trees can be seen the camp and the flickering fire. She turns, and then fright comes into her expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peters stands in front of her. As he reaches out for her, she tries to get away. He grabs her, wrapping his arms around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . From o.s. comes the SOUND of Helen and Peters struggling. Fowler, hearing the SOUND, gets to his feet. Lednov and McCall turn on him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down. (calling) All right, Peters, come on over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Peters, carrying the struggling Helen, heads for the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Fowler makes a futile dive for Lednov. McCall swings his rifle. Fowler goes down. In the b.g. Peters drags the struggling Helen around the lean-to into the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves forward to meet Helen and Peters. Lednov reaches out for Helen. Peters pulls her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall has taken his attention from Fowler and gives it to Helen. Unnoticed now, Fowler is struggling back to consciousness. He tries to pull himself up. McCall turns back and kicks him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rakes Peters' face with her fingernails, tries to fight free. Lednov reaches out and grabs her arm. Peters knocks his arm down. Free for the moment, Helen launches an attack on McCall, who is getting ready to boot Fowler again. She is on him like a cat, swarming all over him. He defends himself. Helen is yelling furiously as she fights McCall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov has reached her now. He wraps his arms around her and pulls her away from McCall. Helen tries to fight him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov pinions her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Helen doesn't answer. Lednov starts twisting her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the pain increases she blurts out Clay's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a fury, Lednov crushes her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurls her from him. She goes back against the table. Fowler is trying to struggle to his feet. In blind rage, Lednov raises his gun and fires. Fowler crumples. Helen looks down, too horrified and terrified to scream. Lednov looks at her, then almost casually he shoots her. McCall and Peters stand watching as though frozen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Fowler) So you were all alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharp) You keep your hands off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling) Let him alone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kick a guy, would you! You scum! You won't do any kickin' when they come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You dirty murderers... killin' people when they're sleepin'...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know who we are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody knows -- LEDNOV (excited) Who brought you here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You said somebody was comin' back -- who's comin' back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moaning) Stop it --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Clay Phillips.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Up the trail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How far up the trail?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moaning) I don't know -- I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (huskily) You didn't have to do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (deadly) Why not? She might have got to Clay Phillips before I did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OPEN RIDGE FADE IN MED. FULL SHOT - ANGLES east. Behind the ridge rises the range through which the pass to Nevada cuts its way. The trail which has dipped down into a canyon comes up to follow the ridge a ways and then drops down again. Lednov, McCall and Peters ride along the trail. Lednov, in the lead, stops suddenly and looks off.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AS HE TURNS, FADE OUT EXT

direction.raw_text: DOWN ANGLE from Lednov's point of view. Far below is a meadow and crossing it is a wagon road. This is the road from Yosemite to Sonora. The road comes down the hill to the south and, as the forest is open at this point, anything approaching along the road can be seen for some distance. It crosses the meadow and continues into the northwest. In the meadow is a snake-rail corral. Clay's pack train comes out of the woods above the meadow and starts down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall, Lednov and Peters. Lednov motions to his men and they hurriedly ride forward into the shelter of some trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the pack train. Mary, half asleep, slumps forward. Her horse has stopped. Steve rides up alongside and looks over at her, anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary starts into wakefulness. She smiles at Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rides on ahead. Steve looks after him, annoyed, then follows with Mary.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the last ten miles I've been trying to figure out how to sleep sitting up. I'm getting to the point where I don't think there's any place named Sonora.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a long ways yet. (arrogantly, to Clay) I figure we ought to camp. She's tired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So am I and so are the horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clay leads the pack train out into the clearing and toward the road. A small creek threads its way through the meadow. Clay rides up to the creek and swings out of the saddle. He is taking the saddle off as the others ride up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws the saddle down, takes his rifle out of the scabbard. Steve doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts off past Mary, glances up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Steve) Take the packs off. And run the horses into the corral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said take the packs off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Mary leans wearily forward on the pommel, too tired to dismount.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary looks down at him. She is hoping he will reach up and lift her down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns a way abruptly and goes toward the road. Mary looks after him, disappointed. Steve comes over and helps her down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gruffly) I figure we'll make better time, letting the horses rest for a spell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So grab yourself some sleep while you have the chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you want to go on, I can make it all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I said, I was thinkin' of the horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Steve and Mary. Steve spreads a tarp on the grass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve goes back and starts unpacking the horses. Mary looks off in Clay's direction, then stretches out and pillows her head on her arm. Now the sun is coming up and driving the darkness out of the meadow. In the distance Clay can be seen climbing up on a rise.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You stretch out. I'll fix something to eat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sitting) Thanks, Steve.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Clay. He climbs up on an eminence and looks back toward the hills.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his ANGLE. The open ridge. There is no sign of Lednov.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D PAST CLAY INTO the meadow. Steve has unpacked the horses. They graze inside the crude corral. Steve is collecting wood for a fire. Clay hurries down toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve squats beside the pile of needles, twigs and pine cones. He strikes a match and sets the needles aflame. Clay hurries into the scene and roughly kicks the fire out. Steve rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve is ashamed of his thoughtlessness and for a moment is apologetic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay turns and goes over to where the packs lie. He kneels beside the pack, rummages in them for hardtack and tinned food. Steve looks after him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) If you want 'em to find us, why don't you go up on the hill and wave your shirt or fire your rifle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't stop to think, Clay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (short) You better start.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Steve. He is hurt and angry. Knowing he was in the wrong about the fire doesn't help matters. He'd like to go off in the woods and cry, but that's out of the question. Instead he follows Clay and stands above him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT STEVE Maybe you and me better split up when we hit Sonora. Clay speaks without looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay spreads the food on a tarp, sits down and starts eating a hardtack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve stares down at him angrier, more hurt than ever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: [As this scene continues, there is heard, faintly o.s. the SOUND of little bells, the kind that teamsters put on the hames of their horses. Over the hill, in the direction of Yosemite, a stage is approaching. It is coming slowly uphill. Soon it will be visible on the rise about a mile south of the meadow.]
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (mildly) All right, I hurt your feelings. But you know better than to go lightin' fires.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That ain't why. I just figure it's about time to start runnin' my own life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe you're not hungry, but I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. We got a couple hours to eat and get some sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll eat when I'm good and ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kind of feeling your oats this morning. I haven't laid a hand on you for quite a while, but that doesn't mean you're too old.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you think you're so almighty? Telling people what to do and how to act when you don't even know how yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: SHOOTING TOWARD Steve and Clay PAST Mary. She is asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay rises and stands facing Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve's voice rises during this speech. In f.g. Mary stirs and opens her eyes. Then she sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary has risen. She is listening to Steve. She is also listening to the bells.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You ain't even man enough to own up when you're wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on, hit me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sit down and eat. Till I say the word, you're doing what you're told.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You oughta say you're sorry -- that's what you oughta do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You keep your nose out of my life, young fella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I haven't lived as long as you have, but I know a sight more about people and I wouldn't talk to a mule like you talked to her and, if I did, I'd say how sorry I was. I'd be man enough to do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said keep your nose out of my life. No kid is going to tell me how to run it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think you're so slmighty -- smart -- Who are you to sit up there and say nobody's good enough for you, like you said yesterday -- just because a man kisses a woman --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: her ANGLE. Over the rise comes the stage. It is still a long way off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: doesn't mean he wants to marry her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to include all three. The brothers still don't see Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay is ashamed but won't show it. He puts his hand on Steve's shoulder and pushes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve swings for his chin. Clay ducks the blow, grabs Steve's wrist. Steve swings with his left, hitting Clay ineffectually. Clay pins Steve's arms to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks toward them as Clay releases Steve and steps back. Steve puts his hands up, making ready for another round.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve turns abruptly and moves away. He is on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She motions off. Clay is suddenly aware of the approaching stage. He looks in that direction.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if you didn't mean it, why did you kiss her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up and eat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) Stop it -- both of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't have you fighting over me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Steve) I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't know what it is to be sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharp) Steve --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Clay) Mind sortin' out my things -- I'm leaving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: FROM his ANGLE. The stage drives along the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and starts going through the kyacks, looking for her things. Clay frowns down at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary's attention is on the kyacks. From where Clay stands near her he can see the trail leading down through open country toward the meadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something o.s. catches his attention, then he pauses to look off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it isn't going to Sonora, but it's going somewhere, which is all right with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's going to Sonora.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine -- maybe I'll see you there sometime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because as you said, that's where I belong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said a lot of things -- some of 'em --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . TRAIL LONG SHOT - his ANGLE. Up on the ridge there is the flash of sun on metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIDGE MED. SHOT. Lednov, McCall and Peters ride through the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay. He looks up anxiously, then turns. CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS to include Mary and she straightens and faces him, her back to the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bends down and picks up her things.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Some of 'em you didn't mean but most of 'em you did. I don't blame you because I understand your way of thinking and why you think that way. You want your women on pedestals. But they have to be born on 'em -- they can fall off but they can't climb back up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) I can't help how I think. You're trained a certain way when you're a kid and you can't change.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you're gonna catch this stage, come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The stage has speeded up and is coming fast down the road. Mary looks up at Clay hurt and shocked by his sudden sharpness. She had hoped he wouldn't let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts off, Mary following.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't change either. Not unless somebody wants me enough to give me a hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE TRUCKING SHOT Mary makes one last attempt to get him to change his mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He waves for the stage to stop.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) I'm fool enough to believe that one of these days somebody will. Somebody who wants me as I am will maybe walk into the place where I'm working and take me out of there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe they will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: D PAST STAGE The driver sees Clay waving and pulls the horses in. The stage moves down to the edge of the meadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stage. It is a small one, a double-seated buckboard with one woman passenger and the driver an elderly man. On the side of the vehicle is painted: "Yosemite-Sonora Stage Line". The woman, middle-aged and rather drab, looks at Mary curiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jumps out of the stage and follows Clay, carrying Mary's belongings, around back of the stage. Mary gets into the stage beside the woman who moves over for her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mind giving a lady a lift into town?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mary) Climb right in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on back of stage. The driver opens the boot and Clay hands him Mary's belongings. He starts stowing them in the boot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay starts scribbling a note. In the b.g. Steve has moved up beside the stage. He stands looking up at Mary.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Will you be seeing the sheriff?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Depot's right next to his office.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE featuring Mary and Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary reaches down and takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve's expression hardens. He glances toward the back of the stage, then at Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay and the driver come around the stage. Steve steps back. The driver climbs into the seat. Clay and Mary look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before Clay can speak, the driver snaps his whip and the stage jerks away down the road. Mary doesn't look back. Clay, in f.g., looks after it. Dust rises. It disappears around a bend in the road. Clay turns and starts across the meadow. Steve looks after Clay, hesitates, then follows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shyly) Goodbye, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Goodbye, Steve. Don't fight with him any more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not his fault, just you remember that. It's mine. Don't ask me why because you couldn't understand now. Some day you will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye. Thanks for the lift.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, Mary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By the way, if you ever go past the Wyatt ranch, have another talk with Elaine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE as Clay reaches the spot where the kyacks and saddles are thrown. Steve comes up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay is looking off, hardly listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay's eyes are narrow, peering toward:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know what she asked me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't care what she asked you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She told me not to fight with you anymore. She said it wasn't your fault, but -- I figure different...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is so your fault and... and I guess maybe when we hit the ranch... you andme better...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) You want to split up? --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (Clay's ANGLE) of the shadowed slope. Something moves, indistinct, and then the sun catches a gun barrel as it disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Clay and Steve as Clay turns sharply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve looks over toward the horses, stalling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turning, he crosses to where Steve's horse stands. CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS. He loads the horse back, throws a blanket and saddle on and cinches up the saddle. Steve watches, angry and hurt. Clay steps back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why wait? Go on, saddle up now and beat it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Half of them are mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hard) You'll get your share. Go on. I don't want you around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE the two brothers. They stare at each other. Steve is on the verge of tears. Hurriedly, he swings into the saddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He glances down to Clay and digs his spurs in and gallops after the stage. Clay's stern expression leaves his face. He looks after the boy, smiles softly and then starts carrying the pack-saddle into the shelter of the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD MED. SHOT. Steve rides along the road. He pulls his horse in, then glances back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MEADOW LONG SHOT - Steve's ANGLE. Clay is carrying the belongings into the shelter of the forest. CAMERA PANS OVER and UP. Momentarily a horseman is seen riding into an open space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steve as he stares. Then understanding his brother's actions, he jerks the reins and swings the horse around and rides back toward the meadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MEADOW MED. SHOT - Steve gallops across the meadow to the corral, swings off and starts unsaddling. Clay is inside the forest lighting the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Clay. He looks over toward Steve, then rises and hurries toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Clay and Steve. Steve takes down the bars and puts the horse in the corral. Clay comes up to him as he's putting the bars back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two brothers stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What did you come back for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I told you, half those horses are mine. I'm makin' sure they get to the ranch safe. So let's quit arguing and do whatever you figure on doin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Is that the only reason you came back?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gruff) Sure. What other reason would there be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) I just wondered. Let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MEADOW LONG SHOT - DOWN ANGLE. Above the pines smoke rises. The horses graze inside the corral. In the shadowy forest by the creek, Clay's camp can be seen. A tarp has been stretched over the camp. Lednov moves into the right hand side of the frame and looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov stands on a rocky hill looking down in the meadow. Behind him are McCall and Peters. They are screened from the meadow by the rocks. Lednov turns and starts off through the rocks to circle above the camp. The two men follow. All are on foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROCK LONG SHOT SHOOTING PAST Clay and along his rifle. Clay, hidden behind a wall of rock, is watching the trail where it comes down into the meadow. Something moves on the rocky hill above and to his left. He looks up, waiting. The movement stops. Clay glances around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below Clay, Steve lies in a cut in the rocks, watching the camp. Clay motions toward the hill. Steve nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROCK PAN SHOT - FROM Clay's ANGLE. CAMERA, SHOOTING THROUGH the rifle sights, SEARCHES the forest and meadow. As a flight of birds suddenly rises above a section of the forest, the CAMERA HOLDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROCKY HILLTOP MED. SHOT. Lednov, McCall and Peters have stopped, halted by the sudden flight of the birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below is the camp. Lednov motions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lednov looks at McCall. From his pocket, McCall takes a coin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall flips the coin, shows it to Peters. Peters shrugs and starts moving cautiously down toward the camp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Peters) Go on down and have a look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (scoffing) And get my head blown off! Not me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Call it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heads.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Lednov and McCall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall moves off to circle around in back of where Clay and Steve wait. Lednov watches him go then, moving to the shelter of the rocks, waits.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And you! Get going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: His position commands the meadow, where the horses are corralled, and the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROCK LONG SHOT - Clay's ANGLE. The forest is silent. Then, momentarily, Peters is in the open. Clay brings his rifle up, trying to get him in the sights. Wheeler disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PETERS' POSITION MED. SHOT. Stealthily, Peters makes his way down toward the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLED PAST Peters. Peters, sheltered by a tree trunk, raises his rifle, then his eye catches a movement. He fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROCK LONG SHOT - PAST Clay. Clay has Peters in his sights. He fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Peters. Peters is stretched on the needle-covered earth, dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE - Clay. Clay throws the empty cartridge out and another in. O.s. there is a SHOT. A bullet hits near him. Clay looks off in the direction where Lednov is waiting on the hill west of the camp. Another SHOT is heard. A bullet smacks into the rock close to Clay. It comes from McCall's position southwest of the camp. Clay ducks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEDNOV'S POSITION LONG SHOT - Lednov's ANGLE. Lednov is trying to get Clay in his sights. He fires as Clay is seen momentarily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MCCALL'S POSITION LONG SHOT - McCall's ANGLE. McCall fires at Clay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay and Steve crawl down and away from Lednov and McCall's positions. Steve grins at Clay. He is enjoying this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving cautiously he starts in McCall's direction.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Stick here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT. McCall, rifle ready looks down toward the base of the log where Steve now waits. A twig snaps below. He sights the rifle, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE. Clay stands still. The forest is silent again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT. Lednov, sheltered by a tree, has his rifle trained on Clay's position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLAY'S POSITION MOVING SHOT. Clay, walking cautiously, climbs toward McCall's position. Ahead is an open area. Stooping, Clay picks up a rock and draws back his arm to throw it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LONG SHOT - ANGLED TOWARD open area below. The stone thrown by Clay, crashes in the brush across the open area. McCall fires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLAY'S POSITION UP ANGLE PAST Clay. The flash of sunlight on McCall's rifle attracts Clay's attention. He fires. From behind him, Steve fires. Clay runs across the open area. Steve fires again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MCCALL'S POSITION MED. SHOT. McCall tries to struggle to his feet. Failing, he brings his rifle up. Clay in b.g. runs to the shelter of a tree. McCall fires. Clay's rifle barrel emerges from behind tree. McCall tries to drag himself to safety. Clay fires. McCall goes down on his face. From Lednov's position comes the SOUND of a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay's ANGLE. CAMERA SEARCHES Lednov's position for some movement. There is none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEDNOV'S POSITION DOWN ANGLE PAST Lednov. Below in the corral the horses are hunched together. Lednov looks down, then raising his rifle, he brings one of the horses into the beads of the sights. It is the bell mare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His voice echoes again and again. Clay's answer is a shot. It cuts the branches above Lednov's head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling) Come on out, Phillips.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lednov. He ducks lower, steadies his rifle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (his voice echoing) Those horses down there -- they don't amount to much to me. Look at the one with the bell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ANGLED THROUGH sights. The sights center on the bell mare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Steve. He is standing recklessly trying to find Lednov in the rocks above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT Clay. He stares down at the horses. A shot is heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CORRAL MED. SHOT. The bell mare rears as the bullet strikes the bell. The horses mill around the corral.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling; echoing) Next time I won't miss.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clay. He starts forward, face set with rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Recklessly Clay raises his rifle and fires three shots at Lednov's position.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (echoing) Watch the one with the white face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FULL SHOT as Clay fires, Steve starts running down. He crosses the creek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEDNOV'S POSITION LONG SHOT - DOWN. Lednov sees Steve running. He swings his rifle away from the horses and tries to get the boy in his sights. Clay fires again. A bullet smacks into the tree. Lednov flinches. Then again he tries to center on Steve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MEADOW MED. SHOT. Steve runs, bending low, toward the rail fence. A bullet kicks up dirt near him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LEDNOV'S POSITION LONG SHOT - DOWN. Steve has almost reached the fence. Lednov fires. Steve stumbles and goes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Steve. He lies still a moment, then painfully he crawls to the rails and with a great effort tries to tear the rails down. Lednov fires. The bullet whistles past. Steve pulls the fence down, crawls away from the opening. The horses, milling around the corral break through. Steve lies still, face down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The meadow, ANGLED PAST Clay. The horses scatter across the meadow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay, now the hunter, moves toward Lednov's position. Lednov fires. Clay runs and jumps into the creek. Sheltered by the bank he makes his way up the creek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Lednov. He waits, his rifle ready. O.s. a twig snaps. Cautiously he looks ahead. There is silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his ANGLE. A light wind runs through the great trees. Shafts of light filter through the trees, making patterns on the forest floor. The light is dim, deceptive. Lednov, rifle ready, searches for some sign of Clay. Then from another direction comes the SOUND of movement. Lednov swings his rifle in that direction, waits. The SOUND has stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His voice echoes across the hills. Lednov sights along his rifle at the direction from which the SOUND of Clay's voice came. Momentarily Clay is seen as he runs from one tree to another. Lednov fires.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm here Lednov.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE Clay. Clay cautiously edges around the base of a tree. He picks up a stick, stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His voice can be heard echoing across the hills. He tosses the stick. Lednov fires at the SOUND of the falling stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As his voice echoes across the hills Clay quickly moves into the open and fires.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come and get me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lednov crumples forward as his echoing voice fades out. Clay moves over to him to stand looking down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MEADOW MED. SHOT. Steve sits propped up against the fence rail. His shirt is off and his shoulder is crudely bandaged. Clay, who has been putting the bandage on, stands and takes a sack of tobacco from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay looks at him for a moment, not angry, but not admitting he's wrong yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SONORA - NIGHT (STOCK)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (rolling cigarette) How's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kind of sore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll live.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shyly) Guess maybe I'm old enough to hold my own in a fight, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah -- but don't make a habit of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So -- maybe I'm old enough to tell you how to run your life?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stares down at him, then) I guess so -- but don't make a habit of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, then, I know it takes three -- four weeks for you to come round to admit when you're wrong... But by that time she's liable to be in China...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - featuring hotel and doctor's office. The sheriff's posse, the bodies of Lednov, McCall and Wheeler slung across the backs of horses, and Clay's remuda, trot down the street. People come out of the hotel to watch the cavalcade pass. Clay and Steve are not with the posse. Clay's horse is tethered in front of the doctor's office which is next door to the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOCTOR'S OFFICE MED. SHOT - ANGLED THROUGH window. Clay, back to camera, is holding a kerosine lamp. The doctor, a lanky, middle-aged man, is working over Steve, who is stretched out on a table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DOCTOR'S OFFICE MED. SHOT. Shelves filled with bottles line the room, for the doctor is also the druggist. There is a glass cabinet in which are the doctor's instruments. The room is cluttered. The lamp, held by Clay, throws a circle of pale light down on Steve. The doctor is working on Steve's shoulder and arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE - UP ANGLE featuring Clay. Clay suddenly averts his glance and winces as the doctor probes the wound in Steve's arm. Steve groans. The lamp wavers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Footsteps are HEARD approaching. Clay tries to steady his shaking hand. He is focusing his attention on a far wall. A woman's hand comes in the scene and takes the lamp from him. He reacts. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Mary, who has moved in beside him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) Hold her steady. I'm not hurting him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe you're not, but I'll sure be glad when you stop pokin' me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Steve. He smiles up at Mary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE SHOT ANGLES PAST doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He suddenly realizes that a strange woman is in the room and reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary lowers the lamp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is it very bad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grumbling) Course not. A scratch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doin' here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Holding the lamp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then hold it a little lower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clay and Mary. UP ANGLE PAST lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He straightens into the shot. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO MED. SHOT. Steve is now bandaged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Clay lifts Steve to the cot the doctor exits. Mary watches Clay cover Steve. Then she goes to the door leading to the street, stops with her hand on the knob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clay straightens and turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens the door and starts out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks for taking over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Thanks for loading me on the stage. I know now why you did it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like I said, women get in the way sometimes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He tried to get rid of me, too, Miss Wells.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep still, will you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put him over there on the cot. Goodnight... He'll be all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodnight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodnight, Miss Wells.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking back) If you need me, I'll be --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To the other side of the street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Mary starts to close the door behind her. Clay forces it open. Clay comes out. Mary starts toward the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mary stops at the edge of the porch. Clay comes up beside her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mary waits, looking up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For answer, Clay takes her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That job you were talkin' about, did you get it yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (haltingly) Because... well, you said you wanted a man to think enough of you to walk in the place you were working and take you out of there... tonight I was sort of tied up with Steve... but tomorrow I figured on doing just that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) I haven't got the job yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But if you want to wait until tomorrow --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DOCTOR'S OFFICE ANGLED PAST Steve on cot. In the b.g. through the open doorway, Clay and Mary kiss. Steve watches a moment, then turns his head toward camera. He smiles and closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PORCH TWO SHOT - Mary and Clay. They break from the kiss. Clay looks down at Mary.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Is there any place in town a man could buy some gingham?
dialogue.name: dialogue
